# Question

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.

```julia
using DataFrames

function audi_filter(df_cars::DataFrame)
    df_filtered = filter(row -> (row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model == "a4" || row.model == "a4 quattro")), df_cars)
    df_filtered[:audi_a4_type] .= true
    return df_filtered
end
```

Execution has been successful (no errors detected). Consider adding 1-2 challenging unit tests to improve the main function - use `@test` macro, organize them in `@testset begin .. end` block.
```

using DataFrames

function audi_filter(df_cars::DataFrame)
    df_filtered = filter(row -> (row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model in ["a4", "a4 quattro"])), df_cars)
    df_filtered.audi_a4_type .= true
    return df_filtered
end
```

using DataFrames
using Test

function audi_filter(df_cars::DataFrame)
    @testset begin
        @test begin
            df_cars_new = copy(df_cars)
            df_filtered = audi_filter(df_cars_new)
            @test all(row -> (row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model in ["a4", "a4 quattro"])), df_filtered)
            @test all(df_filtered[:audi_a4_type] .== true)
        end
    end
    
    df_filtered = filter(row -> (row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model in ["a4", "a4 quattro"])), df_cars)
    df_filtered.audi_a4_type .= true
    return df_filtered
end
```

```julia
using DataFrames
using Test

function audi_filter(df_cars::DataFrame)
    @testset begin
        @test begin
            df_cars_new = deepcopy(df_cars)
            df_filtered = audi_filter(df_cars_new)
            @test all(row -> (row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model in ["a4", "a4 quattro"])), df_filtered)
            @test all(df_filtered[:audi_a4_type] .== true)
        end
        
        @test begin
            df_cars_2 = DataFrame(manufacturer = ["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi"],
                                model = ["a4", "a4 quattro", "x5", "a3"])
            df_filtered_2 = audi_filter(df_cars_2)
            @test size(df_filtered_2, 1) == 2
            @test all(df_filtered_2[:audi_a4_type] .== true)
        end
    end
    
    df_filtered = filter(row -> (row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model in ["a4", "a4 quattro"])), df_cars)
    df_filtered.audi_a4_type .= true
    return df_filtered
end
```
